title: Zucchini and Potato Soup
introduction: Zucchini and Potato Soup is a delightful and versatile dish typical of summertime in southern Italy. With its simple ingredients and warming qualities, this soup can easily be adapted by switching the zucchini for other vegetables or substituting herbs like basil or mint for the parsley.
ingredients: 6 cups homemade Chicken Broth or a mix of half store-bought broth and half water
1 pound boiling potatoes (about 3 medium), peeled and chopped
1 pound zucchini (about 4 small), scrubbed and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Pecorino Romano
instructions: Prepare the broth, if necessary. Then, pour the oil into a medium pot. Add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until tender and golden, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the potatoes and zucchini. Add the broth and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the parsley. Serve with the grated cheese.
